description: From Italian casino, diminutive form of casa (“house”), from Latin casa (“cottage, hut”).

nouns.description: casino (countable and uncountable, plural casinos or casinoes or casini)

entries.meaning: A public building or room for gambling.
examples: A bid by Donald Trump to build Sydney’s first casino was rejected 30 years ago after police expressed concerns about his links to the mafia.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A small house; a pleasure house or holiday home, especially in Italy.
examples: Quirini [was] knowing in the belles Lettres, & highly skilled in making his Casino comfortable to all the Wits & Blues as we now call them in London.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A card game for two to four players.
